description: This is a community-driven development fulfilling the burgeoning demand for urban renting. With bespoke dwellings, onsite team and amenities to meet a variety of needs, it’s not just a home but a complete hub of urban activity.

factsheet.heading: Apo Kew Bridge
paragraphs: Apo Kew Bridge has been designed to accommodate the many lifestyle demands of modern city living. It delivers generously-sized, stylish apartments along with a full package of bespoke, responsive resident amenities and services, meeting the burgeoning demand for urban renting.

Wrapped around the Gtech Community Stadium, home to Brentford F.C and rugby union’s London Irish, Apo Kew Bridge sits at the heart of the Brentford East regeneration project, a vibrant West London neighborhood which houses a growing community of high-street retailers, cafés and restaurants, just moments from Kew Bridge station. On matchdays, residents have a bird’s-eye view of the dramatic Premier League football action on display at the 17,250-seater sports venue just next door and can soak up the incredible atmosphere!

Apo Kew Bridge provides 487 rental homes across four buildings, consisting of studio flats, and one, two, and three-bedroom apartments, available both unfurnished and furnished by Danish-inspired contemporary furniture design company BoConcept. Aside from apartments, Apo membership also includes 24/7 assistance from a friendly team of resident hosts, as well as free Wi-Fi, parcel lockers, and on-site maintenance services

With its holistic package of resident amenities, Apo Kew Bridge offers a community-driven lifestyle experience. Shared facilities across the site include The Local, a versatile space equipped for both co-working and no-working, complete with meeting areas, group tables, office pods, cosy seating and room to relax, as well as The Nest, a quiet lounge space, a state-of-the-art wellness Studio, a gym, and several large rooftop terrace spaces.

Apo also engages with its members in these spaces via a rolling calendar of activities, including yoga classes, street food markets, pub quizzes, workshops, and live music nights. These ongoing social events on the doorstep of Apo residents encourage neighbours to become friends and fosters an authentic sense of community spirit. With most events hosted in collaboration with local brands and enterprises, and some events open to members of the wider community, Apo Kew Bridge is firmly established within the local area as a distinct, vibrant new neighbourhood.

Connecting residents beyond their local neighbourhood, Apo Kew Bridge has fantastic transport links, with Kew Bridge station only a 3-minute walk and offering rail travel to Waterloo in under 30 minutes. Gunnersbury tube station, just a 10-minute stroll away, is served by the District line and also boasts excellent connectivity across the capital. Apo members can also take advantage of nearby access to many ribbons of green outdoor space including Gunnersbury Park, Kew Gardens and the 995-hectare Richmond Park, the largest of London’s royal parks and famous home to Red and Fallow Deer.

factsheet.heading: Apo Kew Bridge Guided Tours
paragraphs: Private guided tours are available on selected days and times during the Festival.

location.address: Galleria House, 2 Lionel Road South, Brentford
travel_info: Tube: Chiswick Park, Kew Gardens, Gunnersbury

name: Apo Kew Bridge
